spell.name: Invocation: Chronicle of Death (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Death's Mistress Patron, Pact of the Tome Feature
You can place a corpse's hand or similar appendage on your Book of Shadows and ask one question aloud. After 1 minute, the answer appears written in blood in your book. The answer is provided by the dead creature's spirit to the best of its knowledge and is translated into a language of your choice. You must use this ability within 1 hour of a creature's death, and a given creature can only be asked one question in this manner.
Source: Mordenkainen's Codex of Allies v1.3 p. 34 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Draining Blast (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Death's Mistress patron, eldritch blast cantrip
When you score a critical hit with your eldritch blast cantrip, you drain the life energy of a foe and can move that energy into your allies. Pick yourself or an ally you can see within 30 feet of you. The chosen creature can immediately expend a Hit Die, and roll that die to regain hit points equal to the roll + your Charisma modifier.
Source: Mordenkainen's Codex of Allies v1.3 p. 34 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Eye of the Raven (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th level, Death's Mistress patron
While there are any ravens within 100 feet of you, you gain darkvision with a range of 100 feet and a bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score and to Wisdom (Perception) checks. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier. As an action you can can see through a raven's eyes and hear what it hears while it is within 100 feet of you. You are blinded and deafened to your own senses during this time. You can end this effect as a bonus action. In addition, your ravens do not require sleep. While a raven is within 100 feet of you, it can awaken you from sleep as a bonus action.
Source: Mordenkainen's Codex of Allies v1.3 p. 34 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Blast From the Deep (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: The Kraken patron, eldritch blast
You can infuse your blast with the power of the deep to curse your foes. When you use your eldritch blast cantrip, you can deal cold or lightning damage (your choice) instead of the force damage normal for an eldritch blast.
Source: Mordenkainen's Codex of Allies v1.3 p. 34 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Blessing of the Slime Lord (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 9th level, Slime Lord patron
The Slime Lord grants you the ability to summon moving patches of slime mold. You can cast grease twice without expending a spell slot or material components. In addition, whenever you are concentrating on the grease spell, you can use your bonus action to move the covered area up to 10 feet across the ground and other surfaces. If the grease moves into the area occupied by a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity save against your spell save DC or fall prone.
Prone: • A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition. • The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls. • An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.
Source: Mordenkainen's Codex of Allies v1.3 p. 34 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Seeker's Tome (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: The Seeker patron, Pact of the Tome feature
Your tome is expanded with the secrets of The Seeker. You know the Augury spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known. Additionally, you can invoke the Seeker's power to gain advantage on an Intelligence check while you carry your tome. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.
Source: Mordenkainen's Codex of Allies v1.3 p. 34 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Seeker's Path (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: The Seeker patron, Pact of the Tome feature
The Seeker bids you to travel in search of knowledge, and little can prevent you from walking this path. You ignore difficult terrain, have advantage on all checks to escape a grapple, manacles, or rope bindings, and advantage on saving throws against being paralyzed, or stunned. In addition, your movement speed cannot be reduced by magical effects unless the effect reduces your speed to 0.
Source: Mordenkainen's Codex of Allies v1.3 p. 34 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Bond of Knowledge (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: The Seeker patron
As a reward for sharing your knowledge, The Seeker rewards you with knowledge of its own. When you complete a long rest, you can choose one skill and one tool you are not already proficient with. You gain proficiency in the chosen skill and tool until you finish your next long rest.
Source: Mordenkainen's Codex of Allies v1.3 p. 34 (Homebrew)
